intro: Sceletium subvelutinum, commonly known as the "velvet knuckle" or "sweet sedge," is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, dark green leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. It is often found growing in rocky, well-drained soils in coastal regions. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
